level.text: Application for the issuance of a special license to exercise the privilege of selling, offering for sale, or distributing goods, wares, or merchandise in or on any street, avenue, alley, or reservation in the Inaugural Area during the inaugural period, shall be submitted to the Director on a form provided by the Director for this purpose.
Each application shall be accompanied by the following:
Three (3) full-face photographs measuring two inches by two inches (2 in. x 2 in.) taken no earlier than twenty (20) days prior to the filing of the application; and
A sample of each article of merchandise to be sold by the applicant.

Each application shall be subject to the approval of the Concessions Committee, which may investigate both the applicant for the license and the goods, wares, and merchandise to be offered for sale under the license applied for. The Concessions Committee may charge the applicant a reasonable fee for its investigation.
The application also shall be subject to the approval of the Director for the issuance of a license and, where practicable, a pass.
The pass shall bear the name of the person to whom it is issued, and shall specify the articles authorized to be sold by the licensee.
The pass shall be worn conspicuously by the licensee while vending any of the goods, wares, or merchandise for the sale of which he or she has been issued a license.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Section 18(b) of the Presidential Inauguration Special Regulations and Rule of Interpretation Concerning Nonrevival of Statutes Act of 1982, D.C. Law 4-125, 29 DCR 2093 (May 21, 1982).
